intro: Psychotria langbianensis, commonly known as the Langbian psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Vietnam and Laos. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous forests. Psychotria langbianensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitats.
